cities: ${place1} has a population of ${count1} ${animals} in its famous zoo that attracts visitors from around the region. ${place2}'s zoo has ${factor1} times as many ${animals} as ${place1}. ${place3}'s zoo has ${factor2} times as many ${animals} as ${place2}. How many ${animals} do all three zoos have in total?

The ${place1} animal shelter houses ${count1} ${animals} waiting for adoption. The ${place2} shelter is larger and has ${factor1} times that many, and ${place3}'s shelter has ${factor2} times as many as ${place2}. What is the total number of ${animals} in all three shelters?

${place1} reported ${count1} ${animals} in its nature reserve last year. ${place2} has ${factor1} times as many ${animals}, and ${place3} has ${factor2} times as many as ${place2}. How many ${animals} are there altogether across all three locations?

There are ${count1} ${animals} in ${place1}'s wildlife sanctuary. ${place2} has ${factor1} times as many ${animals} as ${place1}, and ${place3} has ${factor2} times as many as ${place2}. What is the total number of ${animals} across all three places?
stores: ${name} manages three retail stores in the area and is reviewing the sales data. The ${place1} sold ${count1} ${items} last month. The ${place2} sold ${factor1} times as many ${items}, and the ${place3} sold ${factor2} times as many as the ${place2}. How many ${items} did all three stores sell in total?

Last week, the ${place1} sold ${count1} ${items} to customers. The ${place2} sold ${factor1} times that amount, and the ${place3} sold ${factor2} times what the ${place2} sold. What was the total number of ${items} sold across all three locations?

${name}'s company has three locations across the city. The ${place1} shipped ${count1} ${items} to customers. The ${place2} shipped ${factor1} times as many, and the ${place3} shipped ${factor2} times as many. How many ${items} were shipped in total?

The ${place1} has ${count1} ${items} in stock. The ${place2} has ${factor1} times as many, and the ${place3} has ${factor2} times what the ${place2} has. How many ${items} do all locations have combined in their inventory?
people: ${person1} has ${count1} ${items} that ${subject1} collected over the years. ${person2} has ${factor1} times as many ${items} as ${person1}. ${person3} has ${factor2} times as many as ${person2}. How many ${items} do the three of them have altogether?

${person1} collected ${count1} ${items} over the summer vacation. ${person2} collected ${factor1} times as many as ${person1} because ${subject2} had more free time, and ${person3} collected ${factor2} times as many as ${person2}. What is the total number of ${items} they collected?

In a competition at school, ${person1} won ${count1} ${items} as prizes. ${person2} won ${factor1} times as many as ${person1} because ${subject2} competed more, and ${person3} won ${factor2} times as many as ${person2}. How many ${items} did they win in total?

${person1} owns ${count1} ${items}. ${his_her1} friend ${person2} owns ${factor1} times that many because ${subject2} has been collecting longer. Their friend ${person3} owns ${factor2} times what ${person2} has. Together, how many ${items} do they own?
inverted: ${place3} has ${factor2} times as many ${animals} as ${place2}. ${place2} has ${factor1} times as many ${animals} as ${place1}. How many ${animals} do ${place3}, ${place2}, and ${place1} have together if ${place1} has ${count1} ${animals}?

${place3}'s store sold ${factor2} times as many ${items} as ${place2}'s store. ${place2}'s store sold ${factor1} times as many ${items} as ${place1}'s store. How many ${items} did they sell altogether if ${place1}'s store sold ${count1}?

${place3}'s zoo houses ${factor2} times as many ${animals} as ${place2}'s zoo. ${place2}'s zoo has ${factor1} times as many ${animals} as ${place1}'s zoo. If ${place1}'s zoo has ${count1} ${animals}, how many ${animals} are there in total across all three zoos?
${place3} has ${factor2} times as many ${items} as ${place2}. ${place2} has ${factor1} times as many as ${place1}. ${place1} has ${count1} ${items}. How many ${items} are there in total?
